news.title: Gold and Silver Plunge Amid Sudden Precious Metals Sell-Off
news.summary: Gold and silver prices posted sharp losses Thursday, with gold falling 2.59% to $4,966 and silver plunging 9.71% to $75.78. Analysts cite a sudden sell-off amid falling tech stocks and dampened hopes for near-term Fed rate cuts following strong U.S. labor data.

news.title: Russia-US Dollar Pivot Rumors Rattle De-dollarisation Bets
news.summary: Reports of a potential Russia-US dollar pivot have rattled global markets and de-dollarisation bets, contributing to the rapid downward pressure on precious metals.

macro.insight: The precious metals slump is driven by strong U.S. labor data which has pushed back expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts, strengthening the USD relative to metals.

metals.insight: The rapid 'downdrafts' in gold and silver prices are described as sudden and extreme, with technical support levels being tested after record highs.

crypto.insight: Crypto sentiment has collapsed into 'Extreme Fear' (Index: 9), a massive drop from neutral levels last month, indicating high panic in digital assets.

social_intelligence.insight: Fear & Greed Index at 9. Market is pricing in extreme volatility and potential further drawdowns as social interactions signal peak panic.
Retail sentiment has flipped bearish following the break below the $5,000 psychological support; technical liquidations are likely driving the momentum.
